lines.text: What's your connection with Janet Dunn?

[nonchalantly]
She's my brother.

[Michael and Kate are left in control of a small plane with a pilot who has had an apparent heart attack after a bout of burping and belching. A voice on the radio told them they're entering prohibited government airspace and, in grabbing the radio and handing it to Kate to talk, Michael broke the cabling to the transmitter]
I knew this would happen! I dreamt about this all my life!
Get ahold of yourself.
Since I was a little boy, I dreamt this was gonna happen to me!
Just get ahold of...
do I bring it in nose first or tail first?
Michael he's *dead*!
*Don't* say he's dead! Ask him!
I can't ask him; he's dead!
Will you shut up and ask him?

[shouting]
Mr. Puckett! Should he bring it in nose first or tail first?
[no response]

[calmly]
What'd he say?

[pounding Michael, screaming]
*Michael, he's dead!*

[in angry denial]
He is not dead, God-!
Yes he is! Do something!

[fumbles around the controls]
Where are the wheels?
I don't know. Where are the wheels?
Where are the wheels?

[sarcastically]
Oh, why don't you ask Mr. Puckett where the wheels are?
Ha, ha, ha! And why can't I ask Mr. Puckett where the wheels are? Miss Smartass?
Ah...
Go on, say it!
Oh, because he's dead.

[re-angered]
Will you stop saying he's *dead*? He has *gas*!
[Kate successfully repairs and starts the fuel truck, then crashes it out the hangar doors, making their escape]
Not bad, huh?
What?

[shouting]
Not bad, huh?

[exclaiming]
You want compliments *now*?
Do something!
I am doing something! I'm crashing an airplane!
[in trailer only]
[Patrolman walks up to Michael Jordon, wearing a dress, and Kate Hellman, Kate holding Michael's arm and standing behind him]

[to Michael]
Is that your car, lady?
[awkward pause]
Oh, my aunt is, um, a... deaf mute.
[Michael starts nodding]
Isn't that right, auntie?
I thought you said you couldn't hear.
[another awkward pause]
She- uh, she reads lips.
[Michael and Janet burst into the back of a taxi from opposite sides at the same time, bumping heads into shoulders]
Oh, goddamn...
[sees Janet for the first time]

[to Janet]
I love you!
Get out of my cab!
Where is it? Show it to me.

[shouting over him]
Get out of my cab right now!
I'd love to, just tell me which one it is.
Driver!

[through gritted teeth to Michael]
Get out of my cab.
This one is *my* cab.
Nah-ah!
[the Driver turns to look back]
It's *my* cab. Now, will one of you tell me where to take it?
Where do you wanna go, honey?

[sees her pursuer behind them, looking for her]
Uh...
To your place or to mine?

[with false calm]
I don't care. Let's just go.
Just go straight up Park Avenue, all right? We'll tell you exactly where once we finish negotiating.
[a man in a dark suit and fedora watches their departure and takes note of the cab's plates. And so begins Michael Jordon's entanglement]
